runtimeParameter.description: Optional service URL for virtual machine
runtimeParameter.name: url.service

runtimeParameter.description: Run abort flag, set when aborting
runtimeParameter.name: recovery.mode

runtimeParameter.description: Run abort flag, set when aborting
runtimeParameter.name: abort

runtimeParameter.description: Cloud Service where the node resides
runtimeParameter.name: cloudservice

runtimeParameter.description: Machine abort flag, set when aborting
runtimeParameter.name: abort

runtimeParameter.description: State of the VM, according to the cloud layer
runtimeParameter.name: vmstate

runtimeParameter.description: Node instance sets to 'true' after running pre-scale script
runtimeParameter.name: pre.scale.done

runtimeParameter.description: Optional service URL for the deployment
runtimeParameter.name: url.service

runtimeParameter.description: Title (name) to give to the WordPress instance.
runtimeParameter.name: wordpress_title

runtimeParameter.description: SSH URL to connect to virtual machine
runtimeParameter.name: url.ssh

runtimeParameter.description: Orchestrator sets to 'true' after scaling the node instance
runtimeParameter.name: scale.iaas.done

runtimeParameter.description: Size of the extra disk to attach to the VM during vertical scaling
runtimeParameter.name: disk.attach.size

runtimeParameter.description: Global complete flag, set when run completed
runtimeParameter.name: complete

runtimeParameter.description: Name of the block device to detach from the VM during vertical scaling
runtimeParameter.name: disk.detach.device

module.description: WordPress image installing and configuring WordPress using Puppet on an Ubuntu 12.04 image.
module.name: example/wordpress

targets.target:
#!/bin/sh
export admin_username=admin export admin_password=$(< /dev/urandom tr -dc _A-Za-z0-9 | head -c12) ss-set admin_password $admin_password export admin_email=`ss-get admin_email` # quote the title since it can contain spaces export wordpress_title="`ss-get wordpress_title`" export FACTER_mysql_password=$(< /dev/urandom tr -dc _A-Za-z0-9 | head -c12) ss-set mysql_password $FACTER_mysql_password export public_hostname=`ss-get hostname`
cat > init.pp << 'EOF' exec { 'Perform initial wordpress configuration': command => 'wp-init.sh', path => ['/etc/puppet/manifests'], } EOF
cat > wp-init.sh << 'EOF' #!/bin/bash set -e set +x
data_title="weblog_title=${wordpress_title}" data_username="user_name=${admin_username}" data_admin_password="admin_password=${admin_password}" data_admin_passwrod2="admin_password2=${admin_password}" data_admin_email="admin_email=${admin_email}" data_blog_public="blog_public=1"
base_url=http://${public_hostname}
url=${base_url}/wp-admin/install.php\?step=2
# quote the title since it can contain spaces /usr/bin/curl \ --data-urlencode "${data_title}" \ -d ${data_username} \ -d ${data_admin_password} \ -d ${data_admin_passwrod2} \ -d ${data_admin_email} \ -d ${data_blog_public} -v ${url} >> /tmp/curl.out
EOF
chmod +x wp-init.sh
ss-display "Configuring WordPress" ./wp-init.sh
url="http://${public_hostname}" ss-set ss:url.service ${url} ss-set url.service ${url}
ss-display "WordPress ready to go!"

module.recipe:
#!/bin/sh
set -e
ss-display "Updating package index" apt-get clean apt-get update
ss-display "Installing WordPress manifest" cd /etc/puppet/modules/ curl -o wordpress.tgz https://forgeapi.puppetlabs.com/v3/files/jonhadfield-wordpress-0.0.6.tar.gz tar zxvf wordpress.tgz mv jonhadfield-wordpress-0.0.6 wordpress
cd /etc/puppet/manifests/
cat > wp.pp << 'EOF' class { 'wordpress': wordpress_db_password => $::mysql_password, } EOF
ss-display "Installing WordPress" puppet apply -v wp.pp

parameter.description: Title (name) to give to the WordPress instance.
parameter.name: wordpress_title

parameter.description: true if the Run was already garbage collected
parameter.name: garbage_collected

parameter.description: Define if the SlipStream executor should run build recipes.
parameter.name: machine:run-build-recipes

parameter.description: Number of VMs the user can start for this cloud
parameter.name: Cloud3.quota.vm
General.keep-running
parameter.instructions:
Here you can define if and when SlipStream should leave the application running after performing the deployment.
On success is useful for production deployments or long tests.
On Error might be useful so that resources are consumed only when debugging is needed.
Never ensures that SlipStream automatically terminates the application after performing the deployment.
Note: This parameter doesn't apply to mutable deployment Runs and to build image Runs.

parameter.name: Cloud4.access.id
parameter.instructions: This is required in order to be able to deploy to this EC2 cloud. You can find the access id by logging into the AWS Console and going to the Security Credentials page.

parameter.name: Cloud4.secret.key
parameter.instructions: This is required in order to be able to deploy to this EC2 cloud. You can find the secret key by logging into the AWS Console and going to the Security Credentials page.

parameter.name: General.Timeout
parameter.instructions: If the execution stays in a transitional state for more than the value of this timeout, the execution is forcefully terminated.

parameter.description: Number of VMs the user can start for this cloud
parameter.name: Cloud2.quota.vm

parameter.description: Number of VMs the user can start for this cloud
parameter.name: Cloud4.quota.vm

parameter.description: Number of VMs the user can start for this cloud
parameter.name: Cloud1.quota.vm
General.default.cloud.service
parameter.instructions: Select the cloud that you want to use as the default.

parameter.name: General.ssh.public.key
parameter.instructions: Warning: Some clouds may take into account only the first key until SlipStream bootstraps the machine.

parameter.description: Max number of concurrently provisioned VMs by orchestrator
parameter.name: Cloud1.max.iaas.workers

parameter.description: Email address for SlipStream support requests
parameter.name: slipstream.support.email

parameter.description: Max number of concurrently provisioned VMs by orchestrator
parameter.name: Cloud4.max.iaas.workers
Cloud2.native-contextualization
parameter.instructions: Here you can define when SlipStream should use the native Cloud contextualization or when it should try other methods like SSH and WinRM.

parameter.description: Location where the deployments and build reports are saved
parameter.name: slipstream.reports.location

parameter.description: URL with the cloud client specific connector
parameter.name: Cloud1.update.clienturl
slipstream.mail.username
parameter.instructions: Username of the mail server account you want to use to send registration emails.

parameter.description: Image Id of the orchestrator for Cloud4
parameter.name: Cloud4.orchestrator.imageid

parameter.description: Image Id of the orchestrator for Cloud1
parameter.name: Cloud1.orchestrator.imageid

parameter.description: Max number of concurrently provisioned VMs by orchestrator
parameter.name: Cloud2.max.iaas.workers

parameter.description: Cloud connector java class name(s) (comma separated for multi-cloud configuration)
parameter.name: cloud.connector.class

parameter.description: VM quota for Cloud3 (i.e. maximum number of VMs allowed)
parameter.name: Cloud3.quota.vm

parameter.description: Metering server full hostname, including protocol, hostname/ip and port (e.g. http://localhost:2005).
parameter.name: slipstream.metering.hostname

parameter.description: Endpoint of the SlipStream client tarball
parameter.name: slipstream.update.clienturl

parameter.description: Endpoint of the SlipStream client bootstrap script
parameter.name: slipstream.update.clientbootstrapurl

parameter.description: Email address for account approvals, etc.
parameter.name: slipstream.registration.email
parameter.instructions: Email address to use for registration.

parameter.description: URL with the cloud client specific connector
parameter.name: Cloud4.update.clienturl

parameter.description: Path to the SSH public key to put in the orchestrator
parameter.name: cloud.connector.orchestrator.publicsshkey

parameter.description: Max number of concurrently provisioned VMs by orchestrator
parameter.name: Cloud3.max.iaas.workers

parameter.description: Image Id of the orchestrator for Cloud3
parameter.name: Cloud3.orchestrator.imageid

parameter.description: Port on SMTP server (defaults to standard ports).
parameter.name: slipstream.mail.port

parameter.description: Allow user self registration. If checked, user will be able to create accounts themselves.
parameter.name: slipstream.registration.enable

parameter.description: VM quota for Cloud2 (i.e. maximum number of VMs allowed)
parameter.name: Cloud2.quota.vm
Cloud3.native-contextualization
parameter.instructions: Here you can define when SlipStream should use the native Cloud contextualization or when it should try other methods like SSH and WinRM.

parameter.description: VM quota for Cloud4 (i.e. maximum number of VMs allowed)
parameter.name: Cloud4.quota.vm

parameter.description: Path to the SSH private key used to connect to the orchestrator (used only for some Clouds)
parameter.name: cloud.connector.orchestrator.privatesshkey

parameter.description: URL to fetch libcloud library from
parameter.name: cloud.connector.library.libcloud.url
parameter.instructions: URL should point to a valid gzipped tarball.

parameter.description: VM quota for Cloud1 (i.e. maximum number of VMs allowed)

parameter.description: Host for SMTP server for email notifications.
parameter.name: slipstream.mail.host

parameter.description: Default URL and port for the SlipStream RESTlet
parameter.name: slipstream.base.url
